revised_title: The Geology and Topography of St. Vincent After the 1902 Soufrière Eruption
tldr: This report describes the changes in the topography and geology of St. Vincent after the 1902 Soufrière eruption. The authors observed the effects of denudation on the deposits left by the eruption, the return of vegetation, and the subsequent volcanic disturbances. They also studied the differences in the eruptions of the Soufrière and Montagne Pelée volcanoes.
